pros: good research opportunities, nice environment
cons: bureaucracy and admin procedures could be more flexible

pros: I have a huge rant in the cons section about the administrative performance. On the personal interaction level, they are quite friendly people.
cons: It's an anti-Personalrat. To avoid getting sued, they have no problem wasting time, funds, salaries. A common theme, they have a rule that no hiring for less than 3 months, but they can take literally months to process the hiring request, then they end up refusing the hiring request because, no thanks to them, less than 3 months are available. Procurement is a Kafkan process, you have the funds, it belongs to your lab, so you submit a request into SAP, which resembles the void in many ways, and stuff happen or don't, but either way you don't know why. If you ask them, they will tell you we are under staffed, so we have few employees to process requests, and if we push them they burnout out and leave the job, then we are under staffed further more. Therefore we don't push them. I completely understand all that, but as a result my mental and financial well-being are irrelevant.

pros: There are some very good research groups at HU, I was very happy with my group.
cons: The administration is catastrophic, super slow, very unfriendly, and inefficient.

pros: Nice working atmosphere in HU Berlin
cons: Not enough characterization instrument for research

pros: flexible working hours depending on each other
cons: too low paid for postdoc

pros: It is a famous university.
cons: Paper work is slow and can be complicated.

review_title: Nice People, Easy Job, Great Flexibility
pros: I was allowed to decide when I work
cons: facility was not very modern

pros: Nice colleagues, nice canteen, nice location
cons: It always depends on the department, where you work

pros: Commitment to scientific praxis, motivation, rigorous research environment
cons: Horrible supervisor, horrible pay, deceit

pros:
- Viel Freiheit in Lehre und Forschung
- Flache Hierarchien
- Nette Kolleg:innen
cons:
- Mittelausstattung manchmal so lala, Geld für Arbeitsmaterialien war immer ein Thema (ohne überzogene Forderungen zu stellen)
- Manchmal etwas führungsschwach
- Sehr kompliziert, was die Administration angeht (Dienstreisen, Beschaffungen, Mittelabrechnungen)

pros: good benefits: health insurance, pension etc.
cons: working style is a bit old school.

review_title: Poor administration and structural problems for mid-career researchers
pros:
- A higher degree of international brand recognition than many German universities
- Working in a dynamic capital city 
- Good funding opportunities (in Germany generally) 
- Decent conference and speaker/event offering
cons:
- Arcane, archaic, sometimes incompetent and often unfriendly administration 
- Structural problems in the mid-career researcher employment conditions, namely precarious employment 
- Poor recognition of foreign degrees and borderline chauvinism within the university structure

pros: Good for studying and for permanent positions
cons: To improve all the management

pros: good and interesting work, motivated colleagues
cons: can be a bit tedious at times

pros: Flexible job with lots of insight into university structure
cons: Some people might prefer other jobs

pros: Lively academic environment. Living in Berlin, so lots of activities to engage in in one's free time. Berlin is not particularly expensive although rents have been going up over the last few years
cons: Salary is not very high. Difficult to find an apartment to rent under 1100-1200 Euros. Very complicated to find the right person to talk to for any help with contractual or academic matters. Very hard to get by on communication if you don't know German

pros: It is and old and known University.
cons: Horrible human resource management. Everything is very slow. Very difficult to access the responsible people.

pros:
Good faculty with some interesting work.
Lovely team in an educated environment. Always nice to work in an academic faculty.
cons: Some uninteresting administrative work that takes up a lot of time but doesn't let you learn much.

pros:
- Multidisciplinary groups and departments
- International atmosphere
cons: - Centralized management offices and processes

pros: Efficient, modern, proactive, resourceful, respectful
cons: No group atmosphere, detached employers, individualistic attitudes,

review_title: Good start in the professional life
pros: Great start for the beginning of a professional career
cons: Can be a bit bureaucratic

pros: There are many flexibility at work.
cons: Es gab keinen unbefristeten Vertrag.

pros:
no pressure
nice location of offices
cons: can get one-dimensional after a while

pros: Everything is good at Humboldt.
cons: No downsides to work at Humboldt.

pros: Relaxed work atmosphere, excellent and knowledgeable colleagues.
cons: Low salary many instruments take long time to get a slot

pros:
- friendly atmosphere
- good resources
cons: - more career guidance would be needed

pros: Humboldt has high quality researchers.
cons: Humboldt has not quite-international teams.

pros: great scientist, atmosphere, organisation, good installations
cons: a lot of bureaucracy, protocols and time consuming

review_title: Flexible work conditions and lovely colleagues
pros: Good place for inclusion and gender parity. I appreciate the work life balance and work culture.
cons: Limited to no onboarding. Additionally, tasks could be formulated clearer, so student assistants feel their work is more valuable.

pros: English language and strong resources
cons: Germany bureaucracy and difficult contracts

pros: Good salary. Many internationally renowned professors and research groups
cons: Very slow bureaucracy. Difficult to get travel allowances. Poor career development opportunities.

pros: Responsive and helpful HR, Admin, supervisor and director; lots of mensas
cons: Some resistance to positive changes

pros: Good and international work environment
cons: Too much unnecessary bureaucracy present.

pros: great place, international environment, lots of intersting research going on, location (berlin) is amazing, had several opportunities to collaborate
cons: my lab was pretty far from city center

pros: HU has good infrastructures and reputed research groups
cons: HU ofers mainly short working contracts

pros: Great diversity of lectures, very technical and theoretical program
cons: If you don't speak German it is hard to navigate in the school's system

pros: Prestigeous University, competitive research environment
cons: Chaotic management, loads of bureaucracy

pros: Big university, flexible research positions
cons: Requires self-motivation and willingness to navigate unclear bureaucracy

pros: top level research, working environment
cons: bureaucracy, slow communication with HR, commute time

pros: Great insights into academic Research
cons: Colleagues were sometimes distant and tasks were not always very clear

pros: Payment according to wage agreement, nice coworkers, flexibility
cons: the job can seem repetitive

review_title: Great employer to start a scientific career
pros: The graduate schools for theoretical physicists at the Humboldt University - Berlin are very good. As far as I have been concerned the working envirnonment was very friendly and supportive. I had the opportunity to attend several international summer schools and conferences.
cons:
Albeit this depends on your subject of research, the 
carreer opportunities are rather limited. If your are good you have good chances to get your desired position as a Master / PhD student or Postdoc. However, getting a permanent position is very hard even for the best candidates (lack of permanent positions).

pros: Top research facilities and scientists. The best you can look for. Natural Science campus is based in Adlershof. Easy parking, easily reachable by public transport. Great dining opportunities. New housing facilities
cons: Nothing bad I can thnk about. If anything bad it really depends on everyone's idea of an academic/research related job. Salaries are state ranked. Maybe the worst is the complication with bureucracy

pros: Friendly environment, growth-oriented workplace, colleagues were considerate and willing to help when needed. I'd recommend it to anyone in the Berlin area.
cons: I worked at my graduate school, we were a part of the psychology department. While we were relatively independent, there was a lot of oversight by the university which meant waiting for bureaucratic paperwork and approvals.

pros: There is a generally friendly atmosphere among the colleagues and the research environment is very active and done in a very high level.
cons: The bureaucracy that one has to deal with in Humboldt Universität zu Berlin is quite annoying. Perhaps it is the same in other German universities, I do not know.

pros: Payment is great compared to other German universities, contract for 2 years, teamwork depends very much on the professor you are working for, flexible hours, you get valuable work experience
cons: you need to be willing to work under time pressure and to work simultaneously on different projects

pros: You have a lot of flexibility with your work and schedule and you get to interact with a lot of smart people/students.
cons: It lacks competitiveness and there is no chance you could get promoted because you do good work. Also the salaries are really low compared to industry.

pros: When working as a researcher it means that you have flexible hours depending on your research.
cons: Most of the time common equipment does not work and you must wait for months to use them again. That makes your work be delayed.

review_title: Perfect job for doing various quantum experiments in space
pros: All the staff members are so cooperative and give max support for doing research and attending conferences, workshops, field trip and many more
cons: From my place, 2 hrs drive to institute

review_title: Good equipment and science - short contract and almost no permanent possitions
pros: It is a very good university with excellent scientific equipment
cons: It is almost impossible to get the permanent position (like in all German Universities).

review_title: A great academic  institutions in a wonderful city to live
pros:
Living in Berlin
Prestigious Academic institution
International Recognized University
cons:
Little Advancement of Career Opportunities
Very Hierarchical Structure
Less International Environment compared to other academic institutions
Mostly German-speaking institutions

pros: Paid PhD research and proper insurance
cons: 65% contracts but PhD students work full-time anyway to make sure they graduate in 3 years. It would be impossible at true 65%

pros: Administration is very helpful, submitting and defence process is smooth
cons: You completely depend on your supervisor

review_title: Good university, but very few options for funding PhD students.
pros: Good research and opportunities for collaboration.
cons: Limited funding options are available.

pros: Integrated in Research Groups and insight into many projects
cons: Depends on the groups your working with

pros: Good help with paper work and orders
cons: Not enough out sourcing options to facilitate research.

pros: Well established as orly is of the most reputed
cons: Slow when it comes to process things

pros: Research and learning with freedom of your research area
cons: contract future is not guaranteed

pros: Multicultural, Interdisciplinary, central location, flexible working times,
cons: Socially weird,  messy kitchen

pros: Flexible working hours and international travel experiences
cons: Academic pressure and teaching obligations

pros: Great staff who are personable
cons: nothing was about this company

pros: Good work environment, nice colleagues
cons: Low salary and no bonus

pros: International environment and they provide scholarship
cons: Toxic research culture and rude employers

review_title: Working with Prof. Härdle/statistic deptt is stressful/ or modern day slavery.
pros: Berlin is nice city to live in
cons: The atmosphere is too pessimistic and the colleagues are always stressed
